feed.title: Google Cloud: Anthos Config Management
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Anthos Config Management

entry.content: Resolved an issue where metrics for deleted ResourceGroups continued to show outdated values.
entry.summary: An issue where metrics for deleted ResourceGroups incorrectly displayed outdated values has been resolved. This ensures that metrics accurately reflect the current state of resources.
entry.title: Fixed: Metrics for deleted resource groups fixed

entry.content: Upgraded the Open Telemetry image from v0.119.0 to v0.127.0. This version removes the deprecated OpenCensus receiver. This change impacts only custom metric solutions that use the OpenCensus receiver. To understand the changes in each release, review the change logs
entry.summary: The Open Telemetry image has been upgraded to version 0.127.0. This update removes the OpenCensus receiver, which may affect custom metric solutions. Please review the release notes for details.
entry.title: Breaking: Open Telemetry image updated

entry.content: Upgraded bundled Helm version from v3.15.3 to 3.18.6 to pick up vulnerability fixes. To understand the changes in each release, review the changelogs.
entry.summary: The bundled Helm version has been upgraded to v3.18.6 to incorporate important security fixes. Please review the release notes for detailed information on the changes included in this update.
entry.title: Change: Updated Helm version

entry.content: Addressed multiple Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs) by updating dependencies.
entry.summary: We have updated our dependencies to resolve several common vulnerabilities and exposures (CVEs). This update enhances the overall security of our system.
entry.title: Change: Dependency updates to address security vulnerabilities

entry.content: Config Sync now supports the client.lifecycle.config.k8s.io/mutation: ignore annotation for compatibility with other controllers. This enhancement provides more consistent behavior and correctly reports the resource status.
entry.summary: Config Sync now supports the `mutation: ignore` annotation. This improves compatibility with other controllers and ensures accurate resource status reporting.
entry.title: Change: Config Sync Annotation Support

entry.content: Addressed multiple Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs) by updating dependencies.
entry.summary: We've updated our dependencies to address several common vulnerabilities and exposures (CVEs). This ensures a more secure environment for our users and systems.
entry.title: Change: Updated dependencies to fix vulnerabilities

entry.content: You can now control the scheduling of Config Sync pods using the Kubernetes-native resource MutatingAdmissionPolicy. For more information, see Customize node placement of Config Sync system pods to get started.
entry.summary: Control Config Sync pod scheduling with MutatingAdmissionPolicy.
entry.title: Announcement: Config Sync Pod Scheduling

entry.content: Config Sync's internal observability library has been updated from OpenCensus to OpenTelemetry, improving performance and aligning with industry standards with no breaking changes to metrics or functionality.
entry.summary: Config Sync's internal observability library has been upgraded from OpenCensus to OpenTelemetry. This update enhances performance and aligns with industry standards without introducing any breaking changes to existing metrics or functionality.
entry.title: Change: Observability Library Update

entry.content: Addressed multiple Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs) by updating dependencies.

entry.content: Upgraded the Open Telemetry image from v0.118.0 to v0.119.0 to pick up vulnerability fixes. To understand the changes in each release, review the full changelog for opentelemetry-collector-contrib.
entry.summary: The Open Telemetry image has been upgraded to v0.119.0 to address security vulnerabilities. For detailed changes, please refer to the complete changelog.
entry.title: Changed: Open Telemetry Image Upgrade

entry.content: Config Sync is now available as part of the standard GKE offering and no longer requires GKE Enterprise. For more details on the removal of GKE Enterprise, see the GKE release notes.
entry.summary: Config Sync is now included in the standard GKE offering, eliminating the need for GKE Enterprise.
entry.title: Announcement: Config Sync Now Available in GKE Standard

entry.content:
Announcing experimental features: help shape the future of Config Sync features by providing direct feedback.

  • Introducing PostSync, a feature that lets you run custom actions like cleanup scripts or notifications right after your configurations are synced. We're looking for your feedback to shape its future! Check out the Post Sync discussion to share your thoughts, suggestions, and bug reports before December 1, 2025.
entry.summary: PostSync: Run custom actions after config sync.
entry.title: Announcement: Experimental Features Announcement

entry.content: Config Sync now supports syncing from Secure Source Manager git repositories. For more information, see Grant access to Git.
entry.summary: Config Sync now supports syncing from Secure Source Manager git repositories.
entry.title: Feature: Config Sync supports Secure Source Manager

entry.content: Updated the git-sync image from v4.3.0 to v4.4.2, which fixes an issue that could cause the git-sync container to crash loop. For more information see git-sync releases.

entry.content: Fixed a regression introduced in 1.21.0 that occasionally caused Config Sync to become stuck when applying mutation ignored objects.
entry.summary: Fixed a regression that caused Config Sync to get stuck when applying mutation ignored objects.

entry.content: Fixed an issue where Config Sync waited longer than intended between retry attempts after failing to sync from Helm and OCI sources.

entry.content: Fixed an issue with the nomos CLI which prevented setting up autocomplete by using the nomos completion command. For more information see Use the nomos command-line tool.
entry.summary: This release fixes an issue where the nomos CLI autocomplete setup was failing. Users can now successfully set up autocomplete using the `nomos completion` command.
